This laptop is good for:
1. All 'view' activities like browsing internet, online shopping, emails etc
2. Video calls for online schooling provided you won't use virtual background.
3. Basic office documents like Word, Excel and PowerPoint, PDF documents
4. Use in a non air-conditioned room as low end processor don't generate too much heat
5. Basic software programming
6. Watch videos, play music
7. Basic multitasking as Windows will take up most of the RAM. I was looking for 8 GB ram for this reason.

This laptop is not good for:
1. Gaming as processor is too slow.
2. 'Create' activities involving processor intensive tasks such video editing, CAD drawings, graphics, photo editing, animations etc.
3. Heavy programming like AI or ML algorithms
4. Running lots of background services and utilities that improve user experience but hog the resources
5. multitasking when too many programs are running together. If you normally open more than 10 tabs on your browser, you may need more RAM.
6. If you need a lot of disk space for large files. This machine as 256GB SSD but you can also add a separate 1TB HDD so this should not be a limitation.

Few good points
Dell power manager allows you to stop charging the battery at 55%. This will extend life of the battery.
Thin and light, good for portability.
Hinges appear to be solid.
Not a lot of bloatware from Dell. Most of the bloatware can be uninstalled easily.
Office H&S 2019 is available. I don't see any 30 day license note anywhere. Will wait and watch. If it works after 30 days, that's a big plus.

Camera and display quality is average. With a screen size of 15.6" and a resolution of 1366x764, sometimes you do see some pixilation. Most of the time, it's just fine.
